column4: how do i update my package list ? Isnt the command apt-get update ?
how to update my apt-get list ?
yes, with sudo in front of it :)
sudo apt-get update
yes.. but it has to do a lot of things i think.. and it only echoes two rows of text.. ( note: i installed hoary hedgehog today, not yet updated anything.. )
did you install on a box not connected to the net?
what do you think ?
OK you are on hoary now, I take it - so your sources.list is incomplete for some reason I suspect
have a look at ubotu's URLs below
what should i do now ?
use one of those lists and put in /etc/apt/sources.list with , say,  gksudo gedit
if you are on hoary use the hoary list of course
to upgrade your whole install, type  sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade
and if i have that package already ? do i have to remove it first ?
no
if it's the latest , apt will tell you - else it will upgrade it for you
thanks
np :)
did youmean you wanted to change from hoary to breezy ? (5.10)
if so that's different
if possible even to 6.04 f. 1
ah in that case read the upgrade guide ubotu will spit out
edubuntu installs educational packages :)
got it..:)
